subject: Re: [junit] Running a junit from Command Line
msgSnippet: Did you remember to set your classpath? Nina ... -- I reject your reality and substitute my own.
messageBody:
Did you remember to set your classpath?

Nina

2008/9/24 raj_sharath <raj_sharath@...>:
> Hi-
>
> I am trying to run JUnit from command line. I have a Junit named
> "Junit2" in c:\small. The below is how i am running it
>
> C:\small>java org.junit.runner.JUnitCore Junit2
>
> The following is what i get as output.
>
> JUnit version 4.5
> Could not find class: Junit2
>
> Time: 0
>
> OK (0 tests)
>
> Why is that my junit cant be found.
>
>



--
I reject your reality and substitute my own.
